meanings.definition: Belonging to or associated with a male person or animal previously mentioned or easily identified.
meanings.sent1: Theins cat was sleeping peacefully in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Theins dog wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent3: Theins horse decided to take a nap in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent4: Theins lion ruled over the savannah with pride.
meanings.sent5: Theins rooster crowed loudly at dawn, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: Used to point forward to a following qualifying or defining clause or phrase.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to go to the park; theins, it started raining.
meanings.sent2: He studied hard for the exam; theins, he passed with flying colors.
meanings.sent3: I was about to leave the house; theins, I realized I forgot my keys.
meanings.sent4: They planned a picnic in the park; theins, they had to cancel due to bad weather.
meanings.sent5: The team practiced diligently; theins, they won the championship.

meanings.definition: Used to point forward to a following clause or phrase.
meanings.sent1: She loves to read books; theins, she spends hours in the library.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys playing soccer; theins, he joined a local team.
meanings.sent3: They decided to go on a road trip; theins, they packed their bags.
meanings.sent4: I wanted to bake cookies; theins, I realized I was out of flour.
meanings.sent5: The students worked hard on their project; theins, they received top marks.
